data.title: James Donald Durmire, Jr.
data.text:
James Donald Durmire, Jr., 80, of Hiddenite, passed away unexpectedly on Friday, May 31, 2024, in Alexander County.

James was born March 31, 1944, in Alexander County, the son of the late James Donald Durmire, Sr. and Lola Faye Smith Durmire.

James served in the US Army and was of the Baptist faith. He was a truck driver for over 36 years. He was a handy man, a man that was always willing to help those in need, and loved his grandchildren.

Including his parents, he was preceded in death by his sisters, Marie Brown and Brenda Deal; and his brothers, Clyde Durmire, James Garland Durmire, and James Edward Livengood.

Those left to cherish and honor his memories include his wife of over 57 years, Lydia Jean Revis Durmire; his daughters, Shelby Stewart (Donnie) of Statesville, and Cindy Durmire of Hiddenite; his sons, Donnie Sherrill (Tonya) of Statesville, and Robert Preston Durmire (Nancy) of Knoxville, Tennessee; his grandchildren, Brandon Lee Hill (Katie), Ericka Horne (Cameron), Loren Stewart, Holly Walker (Josh), Cassandra Durmire (Matthew Johnson), and Nick Doreo; eight great-grandchildren; his brother, Stan Durmire (Carolyn) of Hiddenite; brother-in-law, Jimmy Deal; sisters-in-law, Sylvia Jean Durmire and Nancy Livengood; and a number of nieces, nephews, and cousins.

A Celebration of Life Service will be held at 6 p.m., Tuesday, June 4, 2024, at Hiddenite Baptist Church. Pastor Wes Hammer will officiate. The family will receive friends from 5 p.m. until 6 p.m. prior to the service.

Memorials may be made to Adams Funeral Home, PO Box 937, Taylorsville, NC 28681, to help with final expenses.

Condolences may be sent to www.adamsfunerals.com.

Adams Funeral Home and Cremation Services is honored to be serving the family of James “Junior” Durmire.
